required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Propofol Versus Alfentanil Versus Nitrous Oxide for Moderate Procedural Sedation
clinical_study.official_title: Propofol Versus Alfentanil Versus Nitrous Oxide for Moderate Procedural Sedation in the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: This is a clinical trial of propofol and alfentanil as agents for moderated procedural sedation in patients undergoing sedation in the emergency department (ED).

detailed_description.textblock: This was initially going to be a trial of propofol vs alfentanil vs nitrous oxide, but our use of nitrous oxide was discontinued before the trial began and the trial was conducted with only two arms

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Sub-clinical Respiratory Depression and Clinical Events Associated With Respiratory Depression During the Sedation Procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: From one minute prior to start of procedure until the patient has returned to baseline mental status after the conclusion of the sedation procedure (~3-60 minutes depending on procedure duration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Return of Baseline Mental Status From Start of Procedure in Minutes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single time point after completion of sedation procedure, measured from start of procedure until the patient returns to baseline mental status up to 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Depth of Sedation Measured Using the OAAS Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Observers Assesment of Alertness Scale, 5 responds normally to voice, 4 lethargic response to voice, 3 responds only to loud voice or light touch, 2 responds only to mild prodding or shaking, 1 responds only to painful stimuli, 0 no response to painful stimuli

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single measurement immediately after patient returns to baseline mental status after sedation procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Recall of the Procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single measurement immediately after patient returns to baseline mental status after sedation procedure

arm_group.description: Propofol 1m g/kg IV followed by 0.5 mg/kg IV prn sedation
Sedation using alfentanil 10 ug/kg followed by 5 ug/kg prn sedation

intervention.description: Propofol 1 mg/kg IV followed by 0.5 mg/kg prn sedation
Alfentanil 10 ug/kg IV followed by 5 ug/kg prn sedation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults undergoing moderate procedural sedation in the Emergency Department
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Pregnancy
- Intoxication
- Cannot give informed consent
- Allergy to any of the three study medications
- ASA physical status score > 2
- Patients who require deep procedural sedation

clinical_study.keyword: Moderate Procedural Sedation in the Emergency Department

event.sub_title: any airway or respiratory adverse event
event.description: interventions during the procedure associated with respiratory depression, or change in ventilation including an oxygen sat <93% or apnea >6 seconds

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: our capability of administering nitrous oxide was diminished as the trial was started, and the trial was conducted using on the propofol and alfentanil arms.
